titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:13-0400

did.abstract: Linguistic field recordings of the Nisgha (or Niska) language. Elicitation of a numbered list of words and phrases conducted by Linda Walsh with consultants Dorothy Doolan and Bertha Azak. Recorded from 1986 to 1987 in Vancouver, British Columbia.
did.physdesc: 13 sound cassettes (6 hr., 30 min.) ; analog, 1 7/8 ips, stereo.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material has access restritions. Please consult a curator for details.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Presented by Linda Walsh in 1994. This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Field notes, transcripts, and other related manuscript material are available in the Phillips Fund Collection (Mss.497.3.Am4).

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Audiocassette) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recording cuts off in middle of sentence 619. Sentences 620-636 are in the transcript but not on recording.
